Event.name: Vehicle_landing
Event.definition:
<def-root>A flying <fen>Vehicle</fen> comes to the ground at a <fen>Goal</fen> in a controlled fashion, typically (but not necessarily) operated by an operator.
<ex><fex name="veh">A police helicopter</fex> <t>landed</t> <fex name="goa">just outside my neighborhood</fex> <fex name="Time">at around midnight last night</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="veh">The UFO</fex> <t>touched down</t> <fex name="goa">here</fex>, you say?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Vehicle</fen> comes to the ground, usually (but not necessarily) under the control of an operator.
<ex><fex name="veh">The plane</fex> <t>landed</t> on the airstrip.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Source</fen> is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While <fen>Source</fen> expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent.
<ex>The plane <t>landed</t> <fex name="src">from the east</fex>, a completely different part of the city than we were expecting.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a via-sense.
<ex>The airplane <t>landed</t> <fex name="Path">through lightning and rain</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
<ex>Most of the planes <t>set down</t> <fex name="Goal">on the strip</fex> before midnight.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Manner</fen> expression describes a property of landing which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions.
<ex>The aircraft <t>landed</t> <fex name="Manner">noisily</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which a <fen>Vehicle</fen> lands.</def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transportation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Vehicle</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cotheme
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Cotheme</fen> is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique.
<ex>Our airplane <t>landed</t> <fex name="Cotheme">with the others</fex> in formation.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the aircraft lands.</def-root>

Arg.name: New_situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>New_situation</fen> are the state of the <fen>Goal</fen> when the <fen>Vehicle</fen> arrives.
<ex><fex name="veh">The troop carrier</fex> <t>landed</t> <fex name="New_situation">to a standing ovation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> is a phrase which describes the state of the <fen>Vehicle</fen> upon arrival.
<ex><fex name="Vehicle">It</fex> <t>landed</t>, <fex name="Depictive">on fire and about to explode</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time period within which the landing event repeats multiple times.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the landing event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which the <fen>Vehicle</fen> lands at the <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the state of affairs reported by the landing event as understood to play a role in the state of affairs of <fen>Event_description</fen></def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the landing occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: land.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come to the ground from the air.

lexUnit.name: set down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: land in a controlled fashion.

lexUnit.name: touch down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: land in a controlled fashion.
